trends: There have been no other sightings in Windham
This sighting has never been favorited.
Summary: Flying disc, at altitude of about 100 feet, hovering near major interstate highway.
divs: sighting detailson wednesday, november 5, 2008, at about 4:30 p.m., i was driving from my office in londonderry, new hampshire, en route to my home in andover, massachusetts, a trip of about 21 miles. i was on route 93, a major interstate highway which runs between boston and northern new hampshire. i was between exits #3 and #4, about a mile north of a truck weighing station, traveling at about 65 m.p.h. there was very little traffic, and the sun had not yet set. by chance, i happened to look up, and i noticed a flying disc of gray\metallic color which seemed to be hovering at an altitude of about 100 feet, off to the side of the highway. it appeared to be perfectly round, about 25 meters in diameter, perhaps seven or eight meters in thickness at the middle, looking very much like a classical "flying saucer." it seemed to have an observation dome made of glass (or similar transparent material), but i did not see anyone or anything within the dome. it seemed to have four "landing legs" extended from the underside. it appeared to be swaying slightly from side to side. my first thought was that it must be an advertising balloon designed to look like a "ufo" which was meant to attract attention to a business or store. however, i have passed that location on many subsequent trips and have observed no store in the area - and in fact, there is no street or road! i slowed down to try to get a closer look at the object, but it my view of it was obscured by a stand of trees atop a bluff. when i passed beyond the bluff, i looked back to try to view the object again, but it was gone. i have never seen anything like this before, but i was not at all frightened. rather, i was intrigued, and i wished that i had been able to get closer to it and view it for more than eight or nine seconds. i wish i knew what it was, and i wonder whether anyone else saw something of this nature in the area at the time. please feel free to contact me if there is anything more about this experience that i can share.
